dataIdInfo.idPurp: Toolset for identifying buildings potentially outside hydrant coverage. User specifies a maximum distance, and the tool builds service areas for each hydrant following the street centerlines for that length. Access to buildings can be modeled from the front side of the tax lot only, or from all right-of-way sides of the tax lot .
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Jarrett Keifer, Geoffrey Duh, James Kivley, Tualatin Valley Water District
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Tool 1: Voronoi Allocation for Line Features -- Used to crack tax lots at corners

Tool 2: Clean Up Tax Lots -- Removes unnecessary tax lots and erases centerline overlaps to accurately delineate right-of-ways

Tool 3: Create Right-of-Way Polygon -- Used to clip Allocation Polygons during tax lot cracking

Tool 4: Crack Tax Lot Polygons -- Breaks tax lot polygons into edges

Tool 5: Find Uncovered Buildings -- Identifies all possible buildings outside of hydrant coverage
